5 #include "KRandom.h"
6 using katrin::KRandom;

8 namespace Kassiopeia
9 {
10 
11  KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss::KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss() :
12  fValueMin( 0. ),
13  fValueMax( 0. ),
14  fValueMean( 0. ),
15  fValueSigma( 0. ),
16  fValueSkew( 0. ),
17  fSolver()
18  {
19  }
20  KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss::KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss( const KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss& aCopy ) :
21  KSComponent(),
22  fValueMin( aCopy.fValueMin ),
23  fValueMax( aCopy.fValueMax ),
24  fValueMean( aCopy.fValueMean ),
25  fValueSigma( aCopy.fValueSigma ),
26  fValueSkew( aCopy.fValueSkew ),
27  fSolver()
28  {
29  }
30  KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss* KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss::Clone() const
31  {
32  return new KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss( *this );
33  }
34  KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss::~KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss()
35  {
36  }
37 
38  void KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss::DiceValue( vector< double >& aDicedValues )
39  {
40  double tValue;
41 
42  if ( fValueMin == fValueMax )
43  {
44  double tValueGauss = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( 0., 1. );
45  fSolver.Solve( KMathBracketingSolver::eBrent, this, &KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss::ValueFunction, tValueGauss, -1e20, 1e20, tValue ); // fake (-inf,inf) integration by using (-1e20,1e20)
46  }
47  else
48  {
49  double tValueGaussMin = ValueFunction( fValueMin );
50  double tValueGaussMax = ValueFunction( fValueMax );
51  double tValueGauss = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( tValueGaussMin, tValueGaussMax );
52  fSolver.Solve( KMathBracketingSolver::eBrent, this, &KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss::ValueFunction, tValueGauss, fValueMin, fValueMax, tValue );
53  }
54 
55  aDicedValues.push_back( tValue );
56 
57  return;
58  }
59 
60  double KSGenValueGeneralizedGauss::ValueFunction( const double& aValue ) const
61  {
62  // CDF of generalized normal distribution (version 2)
63  if (fValueSkew == 0.)
64  {
65  return .5 * (1. + erf( (aValue - fValueMean) / (sqrt( 2. ) * fValueSigma) ));
66  }
67 
68  double lim = fValueMean + fValueSigma / fValueSkew;
69  if ((fValueSkew > 0.) && (aValue >= lim))
70  return 1.;
71  else if ((fValueSkew < 0.) && (aValue <= lim))
72  return 0.;
73 
74  double tExp = -1. / fValueSkew * log( 1. - fValueSkew * (aValue - fValueMean) / fValueSigma );
75  return .5 * (1. + erf( tExp / sqrt( 2. ) ));
76  }
77 
78 }
